JobFullDesc: Job Description:At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating. Our diverse, energetic and collaborative Global Supply Change Management team offers an excellent opportunity to join our dynamic growth oriented International environment on the International Integrated Supplier Team supporting multiple programs. You will foster relationships with your supplier(s) and subcontracts in a fashion consistent with integrated supply chain models. You will engage in supplier performance, relationship management, strategic sourcing as well as facilitate complex business agreements in support of the various contracts. Responsibilities to Anticipate:Supporting Integrated Supply Chain activities to ensure program objectives are met in a timely manner to include supplier financial, quality, technical, programmatic, and schedule performanceSupporting planning, execution and reporting of material budgets, sales and EAC inputsDeveloping and executing a material/subcontractor strategySupporting development and execution of risk and opportunity management plans, including R6 Sigma activitiesSupporting leadership reviewsPreparation and issuance of RFP's; RFQ's; and RFI'sPerform cost analysis techniques in support of proposalsDevelop negotiation strategies and lead formal negotiations (Price, Delivery, Terms & Conditions)Place subcontracts/purchase orders of medium/high complexity in accordance with all regulatory (FAR/DFAR) and corporate compliance requirementsNurture professional business relationships with first tier subcontractorsDevelop plans to promote cost reduction initiatives and performance improvements (technical and quality) in support of flawless supplier execution for programsQualifications You Must Have:Bachelor's DegreeMinimum of 8 years' relevant experience in supply chain management or similar roleQualifications We Value:Bachelor's or Masters' degree in supply chain, business, engineering, finance or STEM related fieldsExperience with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR/DFARS)Experience with written contractual authorization/vehicles (Cost Plus, Firm Fixed Price, etc.)Analysis of Cost and Pricing Data and determining proposal compliance (FAR 15.4)Experience working with technical requirements of procured hardware and services including Statement of Work (SOW) reviewFamiliarity with the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR)SAP based environment experienceUse of Microsoft Products; SAP; on-line PO documentation tools; Supplier Management tools; and knowledge of the Supply Chain processes and metrics
